Duangtawan Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 7911 reviews

Duangtawan hotel seems to be stuck in the '80s. Everything is huge - the 24-storey building itself, the lobby, the rooms, the bathrooms (.

.. except perhaps for the tiny elevators) -, but everything looks pretty old and in desperate need of refurbishment. Our room was really spacious, and the bathroom was as big as my bedroom back home in London - yet the furniture and the shower, bath tub and washing basin were decidedly decrepit, although functioning. The staff are efficient and friendly, but not particularly accurate: for example, the concierge made sure to have our luggage delivered to our room while we completed the check in (which was nice and much appreciated), but then, as I entered the room and decided to make myself a cup of tea, I realised that the cups were sticky and had not been washed properly! Similarly, one day we ran out of shampoo, but the cleaners forgot to replace it. One last tip: stay clear of the cocktails in the lobby/Marco Polo bar - they're atrocious!

Show more
Maddalena , United Kingdom
U Nimman Chiang Mai
9 Excellent
Based on 245 reviews

I stay here for a couple of days due to some businesses that I have to do in Chiangmai. The hotel design is chic and attractive.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is new and the location is right next to the bustling traffic junctions, surrounded by street lights and sounds. The opposite side is the "MAYA" shopping center which has hundreds of thousand of L.E.D. lights dancing around all day and night. The big screen screams the latest movies and ads. Sounds good isn't it? If you are looking for a fun and full of shopping activities stay, this hotel is just about right. But if you are looking for a quiet, serene and restful stay, then there might be a major problem. Another concerning issue is the "Privacy". My room is on 2nd floor, a Deluxe Corner room facing the inside of the hotel. Even so there is a construction activities going on since morning and last till late evening. It was so noisy and you can feel the rumble of the digging machine!!! The room glass is so clear that it is possible for the construction crew to peep through while you are having a shower in the glass-surrounded bathroom!!!. You can guess what situations would happen if your room is facing the outside shopping street.!! :( For the premium amount that the hotel charges for a room stay vs. the lack of privacy and noisy atmosphere, in my opinion, it may be questionable. If they can fix the pending issues quickly I think this hotel is a good place to enjoy.

Show more
Narong , Thailand
Shangri-La Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1098 reviews

This is my first time staying at a Shangri La. I've had friends who rave about them in other cities so I expected it to be a top notch 5 star experience.

Overall, I had a very good stay. My bed was extremely comfortable, the room was clean and spacious, I had lots of light and I could not hear the street noise even though I faced the main road. Beyond what you would expect any hotel (especially a 5 star hotel to be) I didn't think the Chiang Mai Shangri La is a 5 star accommodation based on other 5 star hotels I've stayed in Asia. Their decor was simple but seemed dated, the bathroom was basic and not the usual marble that most 5 star hotels tend to have. Perhaps if I stayed in a suite, the rooms would be built nicer but I felt like this was on par with a Marriott or Westin hotel. My biggest disappointment was the gym facilities. Their equipment could use some tuning, the eliptical machine sounded like it was going to combust if you went too fast on it and the ladies steam room was unacceptable for a 5 star hotel. The steam room was made out of plastic where there were chips, cracks and mildew

Show more
Nara , United States
The Imperial Mae Ping Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 4125 reviews

I keep coming back to this hotel because of all it's good qualities. The location is great – midway between the night bazaar and the old town, within walking distance of both.

There are lots of good restaurants, cafés, and bars nearby. The staff is very helpful and friendly. There are 4 computers downstairs if you are in need of one, and the staff can print things if necessary. There is a Tour guide company located in the lobby who helped me book a bus ride to Pai, and helped me navigate some other travel issues as well. And the pool is quite long – some of the pools in the hotel photos online are smaller than they look, but this one is long enough to actually get some good laps in. Both the hotel and the pool area have a pleasant ambience. The hotel is quite nice and reasonably priced – it's not 5-star luxury, but it is clean and has a good 3 to 4 star quality to it.

Show more
Harrison , United States
Roseate Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 1839 reviews

Front Desk 7/10 Room 6/10 Breakfast 4/10 Breakfast was all room temperature despite sterno below the serving trays.

Perhaps a bit too much water below the food? Breakfast staff did little more than clean tables and occassio0nally restock food. No interaction with customers. No coffee refills, not resetting tables with napkins and flatware. Diners had to get napkins, salt & pepper and flatware from other tables. Only egg choice was undercooked sunny side up with runny tops. Not a great selection of normal breakfast dishes. Room was in need of maintenance. Handle fell off my bathroom door. Cleaning staff ignored the handle sitting on sink. Also a cushion pad fell off the toilet seat. I retrieved and cleaned it and placed it next to door handle. Neither was fixed when I was there. Bed WAS NOT KING SIZE! It is a US Queen or smaller. My feet hung off the end of the bed. Bed & pillows were comfortable despite size. Top of the bathroom mirror was above the reach of the maids and had not been cleaned in a long time (maybe since it was installed). Otherwise, the bathroom and room were well cleaned. Room lighting was worst I have seen in ages. Only a dim light over the desk and elsewhere the ceiling lights were way too bright. I would not stay here again.

Show more
John , United States
Le Meridien Chiang Mai Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1547 reviews

This hotel is top notch. From the attentive staff, (and I mean all of them, doormen, front desk, cleaning staff, restaurant and bar staff.

I highly recommend them. The hotel is conveniently located in the Night Bazaar area. I originally booked next door at the Suriwongse Hotel (old hotel). I booked 4 nights and I did not feel clean. The Hotel is old and had a very bad odor. After the first night, I waked my family over and booked 3 nights at Le Meridian. I booked though Agoda and even though I prepaid once I did not feel happy and paid more money to stay at Le Meridian. The front desk person at Le Meridian was very nice. I told him of our dilemma and he got us adjoining rooms, Internet and breakfast all nights for choosing their hotel. He didn't have to do that and I felt that was just the cherry that tops an already excellent hotel. That's the service you expect. I will definitely stay again and recommend the hotel to all my business associates. I hope Agoda helps me out with an credit for the lack of oversight on the quality of the hotel. The Suriwongse is not a 4 star hotel. Sincerely George Mendoza

Show more
George , United States
BED Nimman - Adult Only
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 667 reviews

7. It's my first experience of such concept hotel, free breakfast free fruits free unlimited drinking water in the lobby and each floor, lobby like in a café, welcoming atmosphere.

Room is basic with all necessary, the hotel named itself BED, I had a higher expectation than other hotel for sleeping quality, however in my perspective, the bed is comfort but not very outstanding, average linen quality but acceptable, overall regular experience compare to other hotel. Wifi access, we stared in room #508, at most of the time, the connection is always disrupted, I have to keep switch different hotel network to try which one is working at that moment. More disappointed was next morning in the lobby, couldn't connect wifi either. As this is just one night quick stay before I going to Pai, I'll just give up report to hotel and use my own mobile data. Nearby hotel had many restaurant in great value, just make a turn to another side of the road you could find the famed iberry ice cream and cafe. We had lunch in a Japanese restaurant 5 minutes away from hotel. As in total, I appreciate the hotel concept, yet there are many things to improve.

Show more
Daniel , China
Furama Chiang Mai
7.6 Very good
Based on 3245 reviews

I cannot express more on my resentment towards furama hotel. This is the only hotel that i have been to with a harzadous room design.

It has sharp glass shelving edges that can cut you easily on the eye level. They placed this shelf above the coffee table where the tea and coffee sachets are placed and also a manual bin which you had to bend down to dispose rubbish. The galss shelf was place against a mirror backdrop at eye level. While i was taking a closer look at the coffee sachets, i leaned my head forward and had a deep cut on my forehead an inch away from my eye. This left an unsightly permanent scar on my forehead. This hotel is thoughtless and all the staff did after i filed a complaint was a letter and fruit platter. The bathrooms were also not working properly where sink cannot be used. Furama is not serious about their work and i will avoid at all cost and spread about their unthoughtful design. Unworthy hotel. Pls becareful of their dangerous room as it is easy to get cut.

Show more
Tan , Singapore
Dusit Princess Chiang Mai Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 2983 reviews

We went for a company trip during New Year Eve and we stayed here for 2 nights. The staff especially at the front office is extremely friendly but don't be too happy as they tell lies.

We have booked 3 rooms - 2 rooms with 3 beds and 1 room for twin sharing. They have a high occupancy during our stay and many late check outs. Hence, the front office staff was very nice, she upgrade 2 of our 3 rooms to Junior Suite and Executive Suite. We are very happy with her arrangement in view that the rooms are not ready for us to check in. Within 15 minutes, we got the 1st room for twin ready and another 5 minutes the 2nd room for 3 pax ready (Junior Suite). However, they make us waited 90 mins for the 3rd Room (Executive Suite) which we thought it takes too long. However we still appreciated her help and service. When we enter the room, we found it is a very small room for 3 pax instead of a Executive Suite. We called but the front office mentioned that they did not promise for the Executive Suite. The last room we got was the worst of all. It has bad pipe smell in an air-cond room, no bathtub just small shower space which there are proper bathtub for the 1st and 2nd room. Once you bath, the water will spill out and make the whole small toilet very wet which is very inconvenient if it is used by more than 1 person. The bed is not ready and when we complaint again the next person became an alien where they can't understand English. But that did not happen when you joke with them. We won't recommend any of our friends to this place... Good luck to those who have booked.

Show more
Low , Malaysia
At Pingnakorn Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 3278 reviews

Worst Hotel Ever! I will never go back to this hotel. It's too noisy to get sleep at night, due to the sound of the airplane taking off and landing.

Meanwhile, the most important reason that I will not choose this hotel again it that we felt disrespectful here. We left our luggage at the hotel before we went to Phuket. The hotel staff told us that they didn't find the hairdryer in our room when we got back to pick up our luggage. They made us to open the luggage to prove our innocent. I knew it's unreasonable. But two girls in the foreign country, we had no idea how to deal with it. So, I really do not recommend this hotel. If you already book this hotel, make sure there is a hairdryer in your room.

Show more
Guan , China
Maninarakorn Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 2266 reviews

The best thing about this hotel, in my opinion, is the location. Conveniently situated between The Old City and The Night Bazaar, both are in walking distance.

There's a 7/11 (corner shop/convenience store) and an ATM right outside, as well as several restaurants and a Starbucks-type cafe. There is very little to no street noise at night, and in the daytime the road cannnot be heard from the rooms. There are always songthaews available (the cheapest way to travel) in the daytime from the front entrance. The main lobby and spa area are very nice -there are also rooms in the same building which I assume are just as nice, although I didn't stay there. A lot of rooms are situated either side of the main building, and are on top of commercial spaces (not owned by the hotel) including a nail and massage parlour and a tour booking office. We stayed in a deluxe rooom. Although it was a little out-dated, it was rather spacious and very clean. It was more like a one bed flat (apartment) than a rooom with its own little living area! The Oriental style furnishings and decor were very cute, and everything worked just fine. There was, however, a slight smell of damp in the room. The bathroom was pretty much a wetroom -typical for this part of the world. There were also no lifts in the outside buildings, although staff are very helpful and carried our things for us. Breakfast was pretty average, nothing really to say ...perhaps slightly short of choices. The pool was nice and kept very clean by staff. I saw lots of cleaning staff everywhere -the only spaces that I thought were a little unkempt were the corridors for the rooms outside the main building. Everywhere else was great in that respect. This is not a glamorous hotel, but also makes no claims to be. I assume most people come to Chiangmai for the sights and not to spend days in a hotel, and this was perfect for that ...perfectly nice pool and spa area for the odd bit of relaxation. A great budget stay. With some updatin

Show more
Alexandra , United Kingdom
Sanae Hotel Chiang Mai
8.9 Excellent
Based on 614 reviews

If you are looking to be in and around the trendy Nimman Rd. and away from the Old City, then this might be a great hotel for you.

As it is within walking distance of Maya Shopping Center and lots of great hot spots in the area. Transportation options are readily available, if you prefer to venture off to the Old City for the day. Although, extremely friendly and accommodating I wouldn't say the staff spoke English. Also, when reading about wifi/internet and you need internet, be certain the hotel clearly states internet. This hotel only stated wifi; so they did it correctly, but I had no clue that there were no ethernet sockets in the rooms (no fault to hotel). It is a shared wifi; which can result in speeds from 2.52 download and .41 upload all the way up to 24.35 10.31 upload depending on the day and time.. These were my best and worst speed test results... I would always suggest setting up a vpn service; prior to or at arrival when traveling. There was an issue with hot-water; which had to wait the arrival of engineer to arrive to fix and even then it wasn't hot enough, but tolerable for my last two nights. King-size bed was EXTREMELY comfortable.. Wish I was able to take advantage of it more, but was traveling around too much to have enough bed rest; which I felt I needed after 24 hours of traveling to Thailand. I did see them working on what looked like a pool. Didn't seem quite big and mainly because they didn't have a lot of space to place it anywhere. It appears it will be setup almost as you would be driving into garage on the right.. Kind of small in size and hoping that it is separated somehow or better, just don't make it a pool and rather a nice garden with fish or some sort of sanctuary.. Too small to build and call a pool in my opinion; which doesn't appear will be complete until end of year. You can hear airplanes flying over-head, but that is just about every establishment around Nimman Rd., but you kind of get use to it. Room wa

Show more
Ulysses , United States
Thai Akara - Lanna Boutique Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 119 reviews

The hotel is new but only a 3 star property at best. The staff are indifferent and have poor command of English.

Generally the service was average. The facilities at the hotel are poor. The swimming pool is really small and unheated. The water is permanently cold. The restaurant is not even open 24 hours but only for breakfast and lunch. The menu is limited but the food was tasty. The room service menu is limited to 3 items and subject to availability. No play room for children and the so-called library was just a small reading room with less than 10 books. The rooms and bathrooms are large and very clean. Very limited TV channels. The location was ok but difficult to find. Overall despite it being the high season in Chiang Mai the money we paid for 2 deluxe rooms with balcony was not worth it and this hotel is really overrated.

Show more
gerard , Malaysia
Dusit D2 Chiang Mai Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2138 reviews

Good Staff is always nice, but I am never a traveler in need, at least not until my last trip. Waking in discomfort at 3 am, I knew I was in need of an emergency hospital visit.

I had my own car, but realized that driving by myself 15 minutes to the ER might be a major mistake. An alert staff member was at my side. I asked for a taxi. He told me that might take an hour. Seeing that I was out of choices, he immediately offered to drive my car. He seemed so kindly and concerned that I immediately gave him the keys. He drove perfectly, and dropped me at the ER. By the time we arrived, I had so much confidence in him that I did not even give a thought to the safety of my car. When I eventually asked, he had parked the car, left the keys with hospital staff and found his own way back to the hotel. All of this, way beyond what I might expect from hotel staff anywhere. I was so thankful that when I eventually returned to the Dusit to thank this young fellow, I also met with the General Manager who had been concerned too. The GM told me that they hire people to be like family and as a solo traveler in this instance, a close family member could not have done better. I will forever be grateful for the response of the Dusit in my rare moment of serious need and the young staff member who was absolutely amazing. Thank you so much.

Show more
Kenneth , United States
Lotus Pang Suan Kaew Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 3549 reviews

This is a huge hotel for tour groups, but it is also nice for individual travellers because groups usually leave early and come back late, so you have the hotel for yourself during the day.

This is the biggest swimming pool in Chiang Mai (better than the Shangri-la), the deluxe room in the 12th floor are relatively quiet, and the breakfast is OK. Another plus is the proximity of the Kad Suan Kaew shopping mall, and the backstreets of the Nimmanheimin area. If you want to go to the old town it is just across the moat, but i suggest you hire a cab from the mall or a tuk-tuk/ songhtaow because this crossing is deadly for pedestrian. Anyway the Chiang mai ram hospital is next door if you get run-over by a crazy teenager on his bike like i have. All in all this is a good hotel which can seem ugly on the outside but who cares once you live inside! You just have to avoid the tour group rush hour between 8 and 9.30 am if you don't want to wait for the lift.

Show more
MULLER , France
Raming Lodge Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 4621 reviews

As a first time visitor to Chiang Mai during Loy Kratong, we were happy to find rooms that were close to the festivities at an affordable cost.

There was a small mixup during pickup at the airport (language barrier), but when we finally made it to the hotel, staff were more than gracious and kind. First order of business was to book massages for our group of 6 - which the staff facilitated, calling in extra employees as needed. While you can go out on the street and find foot reflexology massage facilities galore, I cannot tell you how much I loved the ladies at the spa in the hotel. My first massage was a 2 hour full body massage and a 1 hour facial. I was in heaven! I pampered myself with many more massages during my stay! Daily breakfast buffet was nice. We would sit on the patio people watching and sipping our coffee, planning out the day's activities. The rooms are clean, but pretty basic, although I have nothing to compare them to as I had never been to Thailand. I found the beds to be rather firm, but the room was airconditioned and quiet. Good value for the money. Location was within walking distance of the Night Market as well as the Loy Kraton festivities. The only "con" was the organized tours we booked at the hotel. While the staff was very helpful in planning activities, after taking a tour to the Golden Triangle, I will never go on an organized tour again! LONG day trapped in a van! Just go out and explore the city! The people in Chiang Mai are some of the nicest and most gracious people I have ever met! My favorite activity was wandering through the streets and visiting the temples! Get out there and explore & get lots of massages :)

Show more
Christy , United States
Yaang Come Village Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 878 reviews

We stay for 3 nites in Oct'15. Booked a superior room. Check-in was great. We will guided to a table beside the reception counter and served with a nice cold drink and towel to refresh ourselves while the staff prepare the check in doc.

Staff walked us to our room and show us the surroundings and the room facilities. They prepared a mosquitos device when I email them about the online comments on the bugs in the room. So nice of the hotel to deco the room with loving swans and prepare daily fresh fruits during our stay. The environment was very nice and quiet even though it's just beside the night market street. Staffs were all very friendly and helpful. Very attentive to our needs and requests. The pool was very nice and see a lot of guests relax on the seats along the pool. Based on 839 reviews

This is a fabulous luxury hotel in a great location on the river with a lot of traditional Thai character--just what you would want in Chiang Mai.

Rooms were palatial and grand with beautiful decor, the grounds and pool areas were gorgeous, and the breakfast was great. Our only complaint is that the hotel is surprisingly not well-equipped for families. We stayed in a beautiful two-room suite with our young children, but despite the massive living room and theoretically perfect set-up for a family, the rooms are not equipped with sofabeds or day beds (only a large traditional couch), leaving rollaway beds as the only option. The hotel really sticks it to its guests in this regard, because it charges an absolute fortune for each rollaway (1700 THB, or around US $60 per night, per rollaway!). This is an obscene amount of money for a rollaway, even for Europe or the US, so being charged this much in Thailand when there is no other option for young children is really a crime. As young kids under age 7 obviously cannot stay in their own room, and there are no adjoining rooms, it's really surprising and just plain wrong to charge this much to accommodate a family in a room that is plainly large enough for one. Every other hotel we've ever stayed in, both in Thailand and elsewhere, offers sofa beds or some other accomodation for young kids. If rollaways are the only option, they should at least be reasonable, and not abused as a way to penalize a family with young kids. Other than this, the hotel was fantastic. If it would only make some effort to be more family-friendly, it could well be among the top hotels in Chiang Mai.

We got one room for three of us but they ended up giving us a second room for free. My friend who was in the extra room walked in to a bed of mosquitoes when we returned to our hostel from our night cooking class! We complained and they put in another room - didn't have any issues after that. Only other downfall is the really small bathroom, the shower is basically over the toilet and sink. Minor issue but may bother some people. You get what you pay for, very affordable pricing!

A problem double booking our room. We spoke to the desk clerk to reserve 3 extra nights, - she called manager who agreed to extra nights.

- clerk said we were reserved in same room. - on the day we were originally to leave, we were told we had to check out. - we said we had reserved 3 extra nights, they disagreed and said room had been booked on Agoda. - we spent the day on phone with manager explaining we had booked in person & they hadn't updated Agoda system - room was now double booked - manager said we would have to leave or move to a much smaller room, we refused explaining that we had booked in person. We had it in writing. - owner/manager said we were asked to pay for extra nights and we had not. This was untrue, we hadn't been asked to pay, and would have paid if asked. - we continued to explain that we were being pushed out because the clerk had not updated Agoda and the room was double booked, however we had booked first and should get the room. - to make it more ironic, we booked in person at the desk to save Chowdhury the Agoda service fees. We could have booked online, but didn't, to save Chowdhury $!!! Summary - we had a confirmed reservation for extra nights, but Chowdbury didn't update their records, and then tried to strong-arm us into a smaller room instead telling the people who double booked that they would have to take the smaller room. And the manager - female - told us we were asked to pay for the room, when we were not. She did not take responsibility for the double booking situation and made it very very very difficult for us to resolve the situation. It was very distressing and upsetting as it was the Chinese New Year and no rooms available anywhere else. I would advise anyone to not trust the management at Chowdhury Home. They must take responsibility if they want to have a good reputation, good ratings, and return customers.

Even though there wasn't a review of this hotel yet I thought I gave it a try since it was only for a night and it's new and near the airport.

At first it was hard to find, I was driving my Thai friend's car and had to call up to ask for directions. it's tucked underneath the more prominent Airport Place Apartments. Strange arrangement, since it looked like M1 had only one floor and about 6 rooms to it name. THe decor is stylish boutique style. Rooms are big and clean. There's no restaurant but you can help yourself to the snacks, cup noodles and coffee outside. Wifi is free but a chore to log in again every time you leave your phone or pc idling or come back in the room. The glass door to the hotel is locked at 6pm but your room key has a magnetic thingy to open it. When I checked out next morning at around 8.30am the door was still shut and so was the reception area! There was a lady sweeping the floor and she told me it was ok to just leave. Luckily I had prepaid. Obviously there was no breakfast even though the agoda booking mentioned breakfast included. I guess it meant the cup noodles. Location wise, after you've found it, is convenient if you want to stay near the airport and Central Mall, which is a 5 minute walk away. You can walk there and catch a tuk tuk to town or try and catch one outside the soi (150THB to the night market). When coming back tell the tuk tuk driver Airport Place Apartment and he'll get you there. It's under the overhead pass next to the large Toyota Sure showroom on Mahidol Road. Will stay here again.

Staying at Once Upon a Time was like staying in my own home, that's how comfortable my husband and I felt over the 3-nights we stayed.

It's within walking (5-7min) distance to the South gate, where you can find great street food (get the Chiang Mai sausage!!), and it's off the main road, so it's quiet. If you are looking to get around, I'd suggest using Uber. It's a fraction of the cost of taxis and tuk tuks and can even be cheaper than the red trucks.

Galare Guest House
8.2 Excellent
Based on 724 reviews

It was my first stay in Chiang Mai. I was afraid of being too far from the main attractions, i.e. the old city and the temples.

Those fears disappeared the first day. Actually the old city has nothing peculiar, it's not like the old city of Lijiang for instance where the architecture contrasts with the new city. In that way, Chiang Mai city itself is kind of disappointing. It's a succession of spa, guest house and temples. So being in Galare, a 15 min walk from the old city, you won't miss anything. Especially since at night, the old city turns quiet and empty and all the action is in the night market, which is 2 min walk from Galare. If you come to Chiang-Mai, all the action is around the city, in the mountain so Galare location is in fact great for its value. The personel is nice and the laundry cheap. If you're staying for a long time, you can even wash your clothes nearby by the kilog for 30 bahts. We had continetal breakfast there which is good but the omelette was too oily for me. Price is not cheap too. But anyway, we loved to eat at different places. For diner, when you get out of the alley, take a left and you'll find a restaurant "La-own" on the right side of the street next to an Italian restaurant. The food is simple but very tasty, the best we had in Chiang-Mai.

Our stay at the arte house was amazing! I will definitely come back to this place the next time I'm in chiang Mai.

The owner bob is so friendly and welcoming. He seems to be working there most of the time. And the whole vibe of the place is very chill and relaxed. This is the cutest hotel/guest house I have ever been to. There is really cool art displayed throughout the first floor and the hallways, some of which were painted/photographed by bob himself! And the barista at the coffee shop in front was also very friendly and talented. Definitely try the affogato- ice cream covered in two shots of espresso. Amazing. You take your shoes off at the entrance which makes you feel like you're entering someone's home. Nice wood floors everywhere. Our room was small but cozy and cute like the rest of the place, and also very clean. The way the light comes through the windows makes it the perfect place to relax. For the price, this was way better than I could've expected. Also great location within walking distance of a bunch I stuff, especially if you're in town for the Loy krathong festival. The only improvements I would suggest would be sealing the windows a little better to prevent Mosquitos from getting in! Other than that, this place was perfect and exactly what we were looking for.

Traveler impressions of Chiang Mai

Chiang Mai is quite a pleasant city but with a lot of traffic during day time. The area within the old city walls are good to walk around absorbing the city life and visiting numerous temples.

There are also a couple of museums. This city has a lot of history and culture.

Show more
Seneviratne ,Australia

A very different city compared to Bangkok. People are much friendlier and have a very different attitude towards tourists.

Swart ,South Africa

Peace and super clean city. Has many activities to do like trekking, drafting, jumping bungy etc... Food is very cheap and deliciuos.

Anh ,Vietnam

chiengmai province is one of a beautiful romance and lovely country of thailand you will see a lot of amazing things there such as temples foods beautiful natural place elephant villege that will make you can not forget it espectialy the friendly people there.

chonmaitree ,Thailand

Peaceful city. Nice place for switching off your brain for few days, self-drive friendly and a lot of hawker food bazaar around.

Kong ,Hong Kong

I Really liked Chiang Mai, it was a total change from what I experienced in Bangkok & Phuket. The people were really friendly and didn't hassle you for money.

The city is easy to get around and covered ute drivers were everywhere. It seems still Thailand, just more relaxed.

Show more
Jarrett ,Australia

Small narrow roads everywhere you go, several taxi and tuk tuk all over, food is excellent, food vendors on every street, several malls in the area.

Hundreds of temples to visit scattered all over the city. Don't let someone talk you into paying more than 1000B for a day worth of sightseeing. Some locations are a bit of distance from the city but an honest taxi will take you around for the day for 1000B, pay at the end of your day only. The zoo is well worth the visit but there are several added expenses once inside. Tiger kingdom is expensive (500-1500B per person) but is an unreal experience too, be careful inside.

Skinner ,Canada

the tuk tuk / taxi price is not standard sometimes, i usually would ask local hotel staff the price as reference in advance

LAI ,China

very nice city... much slower than Bangkok, easy to move around and able to join many outdoor activities, excellent.

ng Chwee Seng ,Singapore

Efter at have fejret jul i Bangkok var det dejligt at genbesøge Chiang Mai til nytår og at komme ned i gear i denne rolige by

FREDERIKSEN ,Denmark

Chiang Mai is now a very diverse city. Every year I travel to this city and slowly seeing this transition.

IT keeps changing to be more and more welcome to international travelers and Chiang Mai will never make you feel disappointed. IT has all kind of entertainment you search for, from great and valuable foods to hotels to shopping and spa. Even cater to those who love to venture out. I often travel there and keep changing my destinations for many years and still have other locations in the city which excite me to make a visit over and over again; for ex, hills and mountains which are scattered all over the entire city.

rerkkachornkiat ,Thailand

If you enjoy trekking, elephant camps, and drinking, this is your place. Having said that, you can enjoy all of these activites equally in Chaing Rai, for much less money, and also enjoy the White Temple, Golden Triangle, and the summer palace of the King's mother (a truly remarkable woman!)

Rach ,Canada

Beautiful and good weathered City in Thailand to visit between November to January for the cool weather.

Moutains/Tree Tops dining, Tigers/Elephants camps, Zoo, Night Safari, Night Markets with several night spots, perfect holiday spot

Tay ,Singapore

Loved Chiang Mai - best part of the visit was visiting the Elephant Nature Park and walking the night market and culinary food tour of the night market

McKay ,United States

Hi, Chaing Mai is a peaceful city. Everything are very slow, it will be suitable for someone who need the fresh air and low noise

Huynh Thanh ,Vietnam

It is easy to get around and explore alleys because the old city perimeter is aligned to the north. Asian families would probably prefer the north west side of the old city (Nimmana)

Boon ,Malaysia

Chiang Mai is very relaxed and enjoyable with many varied activities to choose from, a regional cuisine that is distinct from southern Thailand and great night markets.

The traffic is manageable, very different from the gridlock common in Bangkok. Elephant sanctuaries, mountains, zip lining, pagodas, temples, and many other sights are easy to visit from Chiang Mai on day trips.

Nice place and very different setting from bustling Bangkok. Beautiful Temples, Mountains to trek and lots os spas and massage.

I expected it to be cooler in temperature though, But it was hot (in last week of December). Up in the mountains it is chillier. With Fantastic Views. Must take the road trip to White Temple in Chiang Rai as well. Worth the visit.

I like this small city, it is quite and you can spend time in the city as you enjoy the local spa or you can walking around the mountain.

Beutiful city, warm welcome of local people, weahter is chilling during december and january. Relaxing.

There are many spas and massages are nice and cheap.

Chiang Mai city is rich and busy as any capitol city would be, yet somehow relaxed more than most. For example, when I was walking around the busy city I would hear very few horns being honked. I noticed how quite it was compared to so many capitol cities.

More about Chiang Mai

Located in the north of Thailand, Chiang Mai is the country’s second largest and second oldest city. As such, it provides an excellent base from which to discover the culture of Thailand. Hundreds of temples are scattered throughout, and anywhere visitors go, they are sure to see pagodas peeking up over the tree line. Visible from all over the city, Doi Suthep Mountain features the most dignified temple of the area on the fringe of the city center.

Shopping is certainly an option here, especially for those looking for handicrafts, delicate carvings, silk, and original artwork. Other than the typical tourist finds of shopping and popular sites, guests can also really immerse themselves in the city by enrolling in cooking, language, yoga, or massage classes. Guided meditation retreats to mountain monasteries, trips to conservation projects such as the Elephant Nature Park, and homestays in remote hill-tribe villages are also very popular for visitors of Chiang Mai.

In the evenings, international restaurants and nightclubs can be found throughout the town. Riverside clubs, the hostess bars of Loy Kroh, and the ultra-chic lounges on Nimmanhemin Road all provide fantastic opportunities to celebrate the memorable experiences gained while in Chiang Mai.

Those traveling to Chiang Mai will be served by Chiang Mai International Airport.

Be sure to check out the interactive map of Chiang Mai for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.

We spoke to the desk clerk to reserve 3 extra nights, - she called manager who agreed to extra nights. - clerk said we were reserved in same room. - on the day we were originally to leave, we were told we had to check out. - we said we had reserved 3 extra nights, they disagreed and said room had been booked on Agoda. - we spent the day on phone with manager explaining we had booked in person & they hadn't updated Agoda system - room was now double booked - manager said we would have to leave or move to a much smaller room, we refused explaining that we had booked in person. We had it in writing. - owner/manager said we were asked to pay for extra nights and we had not. This was untrue, we hadn't been asked to pay, and would have paid if asked. - we continued to explain that we were being pushed out because the clerk had not updated Agoda and the room was double booked, however we had booked first and should get the room. - to make it more ironic, we booked in person at the desk to save Chowdhury the Agoda service fees. We could have booked online, but didn't, to save Chowdhury $!!! Summary - we had a confirmed reservation for extra nights, but Chowdbury didn't update their records, and then tried to strong-arm us into a smaller room instead telling the people who double booked that they would have to take the smaller room. And the manager - female - told us we were asked to pay for the room, when we were not. She did not take responsibility for the double booking situation and made it very very very difficult for us to resolve the situation. It was very distressing and upsetting as it was the Chinese New Year and no rooms available anywhere else. I would advise anyone to not trust the management at Chowdhury Home. They must take responsibility if they want to have a good reputation, good ratings, and return customers. Show more donald , Canada Changmoi House Little Village 8.2 Excellent Based on 853 reviews Generally, Changmoi is an OK guesthouse considering what you paid. They got several rooms, you have to get the luck to live in a quiet one. Though I requested a quiet room, they still left the most noisy one, which is room No.1 for us. They said it is fully booked. I cannot understand the arrangement, I booked the guesthouse two months before and in all the three nights they said it was fully booked and cannot offer us the room we want. We had to change to a smaller room which is cheaper than the one we paid. But they didn't give us the money back. The staff isn't helpful enough, the girl's English is very hard to communicate, and the boy, who is the manager, said to us the most was" cannot". Meaning that nearly all of our requirements weren't satisfied, though they are very basic needs. Say something good: the guesthouse has a very nice garden, each room decorated nicely and lovely. If you get the luck, live in the room you want, it will be a perfact experience for you. If if you are unfortunate as us, the stay will destory your Chiangmai dream from the first moment you arrived. Show more WEI , China Nat Len Boutique Guesthouse 8.7 Excellent Based on 195 reviews I stayed here for a total of 5 nights. Upon arrival, I was given an upstairs room which was awful. Roads on both sides of G. House & noisy scooters racing down them ALL night long. The room was also very small. I then asked for a downstairs room and was given a much nicer room - quieter & larger - no complaints. The beds are hard, like many in Asia, but otherwise, at the price,it was all good. Family run - 2 extremely helpful brothers & a sister. During my stay, my room wasn't cleaned at all, but as I was travelling solo, there were enough towels, etc. If this was a problem for you, I am sure they would clean it upon request. The gardens/pool area was extremely nice and relaxing. A real value for money Guest House in a good location Show more Graeme , Australia Nidhra Lanna Hotel 9.1 Exceptional Based on 150 reviews My friend and I stayed at this lovely B&B for 3 nights, we wish we could of stayed longer. It's in a really good location, just few metres back from the main road so nice and close but by being behind other small buildings, it blocks the sound from the busy road. Everything is new, beds are comfy and it's really clean. The best part about our stay was how the family who run the B&B went above and beyond with there service, they really made you feel special and makes you enjoy your stay even more. I would recommend this B&B to any couples or friends going to Chiang Mai, I would defiantly stay there again if I return to Chiang Mai. Just loved it! Show more Madelyn , Australia M1 Chiang Mai Boutique Guesthouse 9.1 Exceptional Based on 642 reviews Even though there wasn't a review of this hotel yet I thought I gave it a try since it was only for a night and it's new and near the airport. At first it was hard to find, I was driving my Thai friend's car and had to call up to ask for directions. it's tucked underneath the more prominent Airport Place Apartments. Strange arrangement, since it looked like M1 had only one floor and about 6 rooms to it name. THe decor is stylish boutique style. Rooms are big and clean. There's no restaurant but you can help yourself to the snacks, cup noodles and coffee outside. Wifi is free but a chore to log in again every time you leave your phone or pc idling or come back in the room. The glass door to the hotel is locked at 6pm but your room key has a magnetic thingy to open it. When I checked out next morning at around 8.30am the door was still shut and so was the reception area! There was a lady sweeping the floor and she told me it was ok to just leave. Luckily I had prepaid. Obviously there was no breakfast even though the agoda booking mentioned breakfast included. I guess it meant the cup noodles. Location wise, after you've found it, is convenient if you want to stay near the airport and Central Mall, which is a 5 minute walk away. You can walk there and catch a tuk tuk to town or try and catch one outside the soi (150THB to the night market). When coming back tell the tuk tuk driver Airport Place Apartment and he'll get you there. It's under the overhead pass next to the large Toyota Sure showroom on Mahidol Road. Will stay here again. Show more BOON , Singapore Once Upon A Time Boutique Home 9.3 Exceptional Based on 64 reviews Staying at Once Upon a Time was like staying in my own home, that's how comfortable my husband and I felt over the 3-nights we stayed. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. One night my husband asked about tonic water, something they didn't have. 10-minutes later, there was a knock at the door. Someone had run down to the 7-11 to buy us some. They really do go out of their way to make you feel at home. We opted for a loft room, which was very spacious and impeccably clean. If you're someone who has trouble with stairs, you may want a different room. The stairs are a bit steep and the bed in the loft is on the floor. The location is perfect. It's within walking (5-7min) distance to the South gate, where you can find great street food (get the Chiang Mai sausage!!), and it's off the main road, so it's quiet. If you are looking to get around, I'd suggest using Uber. It's a fraction of the cost of taxis and tuk tuks and can even be cheaper than the red trucks. Show more Toni , United States Pak Chiang Mai Guesthouse 9.1 Exceptional Based on 60 reviews We stayed here very quickly as we got in late and had to leave early for a flight but the accommodations were perfect for what we needed Alexandra , United States I Lanna House Chiangmai 9 Excellent Based on 38 reviews Chana Place 7.6 Very good Based on 393 reviews False promises - promised the loud construction was finished but was not (8am-5pm, Monday-Saturday), said wi-fi would be consistent but was not. Would not give my friend (double room!) a second gate key or room card (for electricity) and only gave him an extra key after 4 days. Was told to move to a smaller room on the 8th day so they could work on the rain gutter. Did not offer discount - actually lost the keys we returned and CHARGED US 100 baht. Contacted managers/owners, and they gave no apology or discount for the trouble. Shower did not drain, room had no ventilation or privacy as only window faced common staircase and hallway. Rooms were only cleaned once every 3 days, and bathroom never touched and toilet paper not replaced. Rearranged our things (jewelry, books, clothing) into each others' bags and moved our luggage entirely. Best part! Returned home; doctor said the strange bites were bed bug bites. Again, no response from owners. Show more Elizabeth , United States TCH Boutique Hotel 9.2 Exceptional Based on 56 reviews Galare Guest House 8.2 Excellent Based on 724 reviews It was my first stay in Chiang Mai. I was afraid of being too far from the main attractions, i.e. the old city and the temples. Those fears disappeared the first day. Actually the old city has nothing peculiar, it's not like the old city of Lijiang for instance where the architecture contrasts with the new city. In that way, Chiang Mai city itself is kind of disappointing. It's a succession of spa, guest house and temples. So being in Galare, a 15 min walk from the old city, you won't miss anything. Especially since at night, the old city turns quiet and empty and all the action is in the night market, which is 2 min walk from Galare. If you come to Chiang-Mai, all the action is around the city, in the mountain so Galare location is in fact great for its value. The personel is nice and the laundry cheap. If you're staying for a long time, you can even wash your clothes nearby by the kilog for 30 bahts. We had continetal breakfast there which is good but the omelette was too oily for me. Price is not cheap too. But anyway, we loved to eat at different places. For diner, when you get out of the alley, take a left and you'll find a restaurant "La-own" on the right side of the street next to an Italian restaurant. The food is simple but very tasty, the best we had in Chiang-Mai. Show more Nicolas , France Thana Hotel & Guesthouse 6.8 Good Based on 269 reviews My friend and I have stayed at thana hotel about 4-5 times and we have enjoyed our time there. We have also suggested to over 10 friends in our travels who have all stayed there. The day staff are lovely, very friendly and very welcoming however there is one gentleman who works as part of the night staff and he lets the whole hotel down. From friendly and welcoming by day the staff at this hotel turn into a total disgrace. He is rude, ignorant and finally extremely aggressive! I was at the hotel the other day and me and my friend has some music on at a reasonable level of volume about 9pm and instead of politely coming to ask us to turn it down he came up with a metal pole threatening us with his top off. He is insane, how he is working in hospitality is beyond me I think he should be put into a zoo if I'm truly honest, he's an animal. So looking back now he has let the hotel down. My friend and I shall return and we truly hope this mentalist has been removed from the staff. A massive shame as everyone else is truly wonderful and the hotel is a lovely place to be in a great area. Show more Charlie , Australia Sridonchai Heritage Night Bazaar Chiang Mai 9.6 Exceptional Based on 21 reviews Arte House 9.4 Exceptional Based on 165 reviews Our stay at the arte house was amazing! I will definitely come back to this place the next time I'm in chiang Mai. The owner bob is so friendly and welcoming. He seems to be working there most of the time. And the whole vibe of the place is very chill and relaxed. This is the cutest hotel/guest house I have ever been to. There is really cool art displayed throughout the first floor and the hallways, some of which were painted/photographed by bob himself! And the barista at the coffee shop in front was also very friendly and talented. Definitely try the affogato- ice cream covered in two shots of espresso. Amazing. You take your shoes off at the entrance which makes you feel like you're entering someone's home. Nice wood floors everywhere. Our room was small but cozy and cute like the rest of the place, and also very clean. The way the light comes through the windows makes it the perfect place to relax. For the price, this was way better than I could've expected. Also great location within walking distance of a bunch I stuff, especially if you're in town for the Loy krathong festival. The only improvements I would suggest would be sealing the windows a little better to prevent Mosquitos from getting in! Other than that, this place was perfect and exactly what we were looking for. Show more Tessa , United States Ban Kong Rao Yododo Resort 8.2 Excellent Based on 86 reviews Most of the staff does not speak English. The non-English speaking staff was rather unfriendly and could hardly be convinced to help me at all. The rooms are OK but VERY noisy at night. The street directly in front of the hotel is quite busy at night. There are lots of scooters and tuktuks at night and some of love to accelerate in front of the hotel, which makes quite a lot of noise. The walls are thin and it made no noticeable difference if the windows were open or not. The bed had a good size but the mattress was as stiff as a brick. The same can be said about the pillows. The TV programm was good. The hotel is about 15-20min walking distance away from the inner city and most tourist attractions, proper restaurants etc. are too far away to walk. Wifi was available downstairs but not in my room on the 4th floor. The connection was slow but OK. I booked a 2nd stay in advance with agoda but tried to cancel it during my 1st stay. Although the cancelation was 10 days in advance, no refund at all was granted. They told me that they did not get the money from agoda yet and they also have to pay a commission to agoda, so no refund was granted. All in all I would not recommend this hotel. Show more Robert , Germany Sri Pat Guest House 8.5 Excellent Based on 420 reviews Pleasantly surprised at the nice location, close to local market where many Thai cooking classes shop, facilities for massage, laundry, interesting small cafes/restaurants, both local and modern shops. Easy tuktuk ride to night markets, airport. Very pleasant staff, very clean and nicely designed lobby, small outdoor pool. Deluxe poolview room spacious, with usual coffee/tea/water supplies, lots of closet and drawer space, minifridge, reasonably fast free internet. Appreciated the balcony thru patio doors, with lush foliage providing some privacy, good sized bathroom with modern glassed shower, good water pressure. A/C worked well. Furnishings wooden Thai style,very pleasing; bed comfortable with nice duvet bedding. Large flat screen TV with quite a few English channels. Only downside, up on 3rd floor, no elevator but staff quite readily brought luggage up and down; breakfast not included, but available. Found all kinds of nearby cafes with tasty and very reasonably priced breakfasts Our new favorite is fresh fruit shake - found at many nearby stands - passionfruit especially so refreshing and tangy. Overall very satisfied and highly recommend. Show more Helen , Canada Little Bear's Home 8.5 Excellent Based on 89 reviews Great location (massage, food, 7-11, attractions, Sunday night market are just walking distance) The hotel is very spacious, clean and neat. .. traveller can ask the receptionist to help rent a motorbike or car to go round the city (please take note if on Sunday, the motorbike bike, car nor taxi can't reach the hotel in the evening since all the road are close for the market) The only thing that's not too perfect is the staircase, me and my friends was staying there 3 nights in different room (bcos the room was full so booked in different category) first night at level 4, second n third night at level 3, it's really quite tired climbing up the stairs with the big luggage and there's not even a staff to help us... Worth staying, I'll recommend for my friend... Based on 645 reviews Traveler impressions of Chiang Mai Chiang Mai is quite a pleasant city but with a lot of traffic during day time. The area within the old city walls are good to walk around absorbing the city life and visiting numerous temples. There are also a couple of museums. This city has a lot of history and culture. Show more Seneviratne ,Australia A very different city compared to Bangkok. People are much friendlier and have a very different attitude towards tourists. Swart ,South Africa Peace and super clean city. Has many activities to do like trekking, drafting, jumping bungy etc... Food is very cheap and deliciuos. Anh ,Vietnam chiengmai province is one of a beautiful romance and lovely country of thailand you will see a lot of amazing things there such as temples foods beautiful natural place elephant villege that will make you can not forget it espectialy the friendly people there. chonmaitree ,Thailand Peaceful city. Nice place for switching off your brain for few days, self-drive friendly and a lot of hawker food bazaar around. Kong ,Hong Kong I Really liked Chiang Mai, it was a total change from what I experienced in Bangkok & Phuket. The people were really friendly and didn't hassle you for money. The city is easy to get around and covered ute drivers were everywhere. It seems still Thailand, just more relaxed. Show more Jarrett ,Australia Small narrow roads everywhere you go, several taxi and tuk tuk all over, food is excellent, food vendors on every street, several malls in the area. Hundreds of temples to visit scattered all over the city. Don't let someone talk you into paying more than 1000B for a day worth of sightseeing. Some locations are a bit of distance from the city but an honest taxi will take you around for the day for 1000B, pay at the end of your day only. The zoo is well worth the visit but there are several added expenses once inside. Tiger kingdom is expensive (500-1500B per person) but is an unreal experience too, be careful inside. Show more Skinner ,Canada the tuk tuk / taxi price is not standard sometimes, i usually would ask local hotel staff the price as reference in advance LAI ,China very nice city... much slower than Bangkok, easy to move around and able to join many outdoor activities, excellent. ng Chwee Seng ,Singapore Efter at have fejret jul i Bangkok var det dejligt at genbesøge Chiang Mai til nytår og at komme ned i gear i denne rolige by FREDERIKSEN ,Denmark Chiang Mai is now a very diverse city. Every year I travel to this city and slowly seeing this transition. IT keeps changing to be more and more welcome to international travelers and Chiang Mai will never make you feel disappointed. IT has all kind of entertainment you search for, from great and valuable foods to hotels to shopping and spa. Even cater to those who love to venture out. I often travel there and keep changing my destinations for many years and still have other locations in the city which excite me to make a visit over and over again; for ex, hills and mountains which are scattered all over the entire city. Show more rerkkachornkiat ,Thailand If you enjoy trekking, elephant camps, and drinking, this is your place. Having said that, you can enjoy all of these activites equally in Chaing Rai, for much less money, and also enjoy the White Temple, Golden Triangle, and the summer palace of the King's mother (a truly remarkable woman!) Rach ,Canada Beautiful and good weathered City in Thailand to visit between November to January for the cool weather. Moutains/Tree Tops dining, Tigers/Elephants camps, Zoo, Night Safari, Night Markets with several night spots, perfect holiday spot Show more Tay ,Singapore Loved Chiang Mai - best part of the visit was visiting the Elephant Nature Park and walking the night market and culinary food tour of the night market McKay ,United States Hi, Chaing Mai is a peaceful city. Everything are very slow, it will be suitable for someone who need the fresh air and low noise Huynh Thanh ,Vietnam It is easy to get around and explore alleys because the old city perimeter is aligned to the north. Asian families would probably prefer the north west side of the old city (Nimmana) Boon ,Malaysia Chiang Mai is very relaxed and enjoyable with many varied activities to choose from, a regional cuisine that is distinct from southern Thailand and great night markets. The traffic is manageable, very different from the gridlock common in Bangkok. Elephant sanctuaries, mountains, zip lining, pagodas, temples, and many other sights are easy to visit from Chiang Mai on day trips. Show more Collins ,United States Nice place and very different setting from bustling Bangkok. Beautiful Temples, Mountains to trek and lots os spas and massage. I expected it to be cooler in temperature though, But it was hot (in last week of December). Up in the mountains it is chillier. With Fantastic Views. Must take the road trip to White Temple in Chiang Rai as well. Worth the visit. Show more Balakrishnan ,Singapore I like this small city, it is quite and you can spend time in the city as you enjoy the local spa or you can walking around the mountain. lv ,China Very lively city, a lot to see and do. Great cooking classes. Main thing to know : tourist must stay in the city as city traffic management is verypoor : red lights take between 3 and 4 minutes, as a result it can take 45 MINUTES TO ONE HOURS FOR A MILE ! TARDY ,France Beutiful city, warm welcome of local people, weahter is chilling during december and january. Relaxing. BOON GEE ,Malaysia A huge range of activities in and around Chiang Mai, which will suit all types. Rivers, Mountains, Caves, Gardens, Elephants etc etc Often changing, so best to consult local tour operators. OSULLIVAN ,United Kingdom Chiang Mai is the base to go do many different outdoor activities in the mountains and the countryside: hiking, rafting, climbing, kayaking etc. There are many spas and massages are nice and cheap. Show more Harrison ,Australia Chiang Mai is a hub of many surrounding destinations. The airport is wonderful and modern and the transportation to and from is easy and affordable. Chiang Mai city is rich and busy as any capitol city would be, yet somehow relaxed more than most. For example, when I was walking around the busy city I would hear very few horns being honked. I noticed how quite it was compared to so many capitol cities. Show more lewis ,United States If have time, suggest to go up on hill in winter season and stay there for few days, natural view, weather, local food and friendliness of people Sringamphong ,Thailand One of the most beautiful cities I have visited. Lots to do and see whether shopping, night life, dining, and massages for relaxing. I particularly like the historical museums, a day trip by itself. Also visited an elephant sanctuary---wonderful working with the elephants. On a previous trip, I took a trek into the mountains and stayed with a Karen tribe. Very memorable. Show more De Wald ,United States Chiang Mai is most beautiful city, you can enjoy with every place and have many activities around there especially about cultural and traditional. Sukprajun ,Thailand great place to visit the sites but I recommend renting a car with a GPS to get around in. The city can be a little confusing without a GPS. If you like golf, there are a few nice courses in a 30 minute vicinity. Show more mier ,United States Love Chiang Mai but the decision to close bars at 12am spoilt this trip for me. During the day I am busy enjoying al the activities in the area and like my wee snooze before I go out socialising but by the time I had dinner then on to the bars I was left with about 2 hours max . Just getting into the mood and bars close. Show more Adamson ,United Kingdom Nice place for those like to eat and enjoy coffee, there're a lot of coffee shop, restaurants and dessert shops in Nimmanna Haeminda Rd. In the old city, there're a lot of historical places (especially temples). Lanna Folklife Museum is very interesting. Outside the city, there are a lot of Doi (mountain) for you to explore, trekking places and waterfall. Show more Yuenyong ,Thailand Discover the neighborhoods of Chiang Mai Old City 686 hotels Nimmanhemin 297 hotels Huay Kaew 283 hotels Chiang Mai Airport 199 hotels Hang Dong 175 hotels Mae Rim 148 hotels Charoenmueng 143 hotels Chang Khlan 140 hotels Tha Phae 133 hotels Night Bazaar 129 hotels Wua Lai 126 hotels San Sai 117 hotels Su Thep 101 hotels Chang Phuak 92 hotels Tha Sala 79 hotels Doi Saket 77 hotels Chiang Mai Riverside 75 hotels Chang Moi 58 hotels Mae Taeng 51 hotels San Phe Suea 43 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Guest Houses in Chiang Mai 664 Hostels in Chiang Mai 299 Apartments in Chiang Mai 291 Resorts in Chiang Mai 262 Serviced Apartments in Chiang Mai 120 More about Chiang Mai Located in the north of Thailand, Chiang Mai is the country’s second largest and second oldest city. As such, it provides an excellent base from which to discover the culture of Thailand. Hundreds of temples are scattered throughout, and anywhere visitors go, they are sure to see pagodas peeking up over the tree line. Visible from all over the city, Doi Suthep Mountain features the most dignified temple of the area on the fringe of the city center. Shopping is certainly an option here, especially for those looking for handicrafts, delicate carvings, silk, and original artwork. Other than the typical tourist finds of shopping and popular sites, guests can also really immerse themselves in the city by enrolling in cooking, language, yoga, or massage classes. Guided meditation retreats to mountain monasteries, trips to conservation projects such as the Elephant Nature Park, and homestays in remote hill-tribe villages are also very popular for visitors of Chiang Mai. In the evenings, international restaurants and nightclubs can be found throughout the town. Riverside clubs, the hostess bars of Loy Kroh, and the ultra-chic lounges on Nimmanhemin Road all provide fantastic opportunities to celebrate the memorable experiences gained while in Chiang Mai. Those traveling to Chiang Mai will be served by Chiang Mai International Airport . Be sure to check out the interactive map of Chiang Mai for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.
